content.question: Which of the following is an example of an environmental benefit of aquaculture?

choices.label: Raising large numbers of fish in a small area near the shore will increase the profitability of the fish harvest.
Raising fish using aquaculture and feeding human populations with the harvest reduces the number of fish caught from the ocean.
Aquaculture supports the food supply for humans, and the fish can also be released into the wild to repopulate the ocean.
Aquaculture results in large amounts of fish that can feed large numbers of people and help to increase human population growth.

content.answer: Raising fish using aquaculture and feeding human populations with the harvest reduces the number of fish caught from the ocean.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Describe disadvantages, advantages, or unintended consequences for potential solutions.
